attributes.title: Lee Cooper Denim Jeans
attributes.description:
Created on September 23, 2010 by jenniferksharpe on Sourcemap.org:

Map created based on article in The Guardian: Story of the Blues. http://www.guardian.co.uk/g2/story/0,,497788,00.html

attributes.name: Lee Cooper Denim Jeans
attributes.title: Lee Cooper Denim Jeans
attributes.description: Map created based on article in The Guardian: Story of the Blues. http://www.guardian.co.uk/g2/story/0,,497788,00.html

attributes.name: Cotton
attributes.title: Cotton
attributes.description:
"Benin is one of several cotton-growing countries in west Africa, and there is a permanent carnival air.... But a closer look at Benins cotton industry, the mainstay of its economy, is not so cheering. Corruption and mismanagement keep most cotton-farmers here as poor as when France introduced the crop to the region 100 years ago. And where a little technology filters down, in insecticides and fertilisers, people are dying. During last years cotton season here, about 100 people died from poisoning thanks to the pesticide endosulfin, one of a number of dangerous chemicals being dumped on west Africas cotton-growers, despite being banned by some wealthier countries."
http://www.guardian.co.uk/g2/story/0,,497788,00.html

attributes.name: Pocketing
attributes.title: Pocketing
attributes.description: Milled and heat treated, before heading to Tunisia for assembly.

attributes.name: Polyester Threads
attributes.title: Polyester Threads
attributes.description:
"Coats Viyella makes these threads and they may all look the same to you or me, apart from their orange, white or blue colouring, but there are different thicknesses, different strengths, for different parts of the job... They get dyed in Spain and wound on to spools in Tunis before being delivered to Ras Jebel."
http://www.guardian.co.uk/g2/story/0,,497788,00.html

attributes.name: Zipper
attributes.title: Zipper
attributes.description:
"...the polyester tape for the zip, which coincidentally is made in France by a Japanese company, YKK. The brass wire that makes up the teeth of the zip comes from Japan..."
http://www.guardian.co.uk/g2/story/0,,497788,00.html

attributes.name: Rivets & Buttons
attributes.title: Rivets & Buttons
attributes.description:
"Brass, of course, is an alloy made mainly of copper with a little zinc. And it is brass, again, that goes to make the rivets and part of the buttons. They come from Prym, a German-based firm that makes its own brass using zinc and copper from Australia and Namibia."
http://www.guardian.co.uk/g2/story/0,,497788,00.html

attributes.name: Denim Fabric
attributes.title: Denim Fabric
attributes.description: Spun, milled, and dyed using synthetic indigo.

attributes.name: Pumice
attributes.title: Pumice
attributes.description:
"This stonewashing, by the way, is one of the dirtier processes involved in jeans production. Although the Italdenim factory has all the best environmentally friendly equipment, much of the dye is washed out at Ras Jebel, which does not. The indigo itself is benign, but when it finds its way into local streams it cuts out the light in the water and kills plants and fish. The pumice, replaced now by an enzyme treatment in modern European factories, is reduced to a powder and then discarded. A factory like this can produce several tons of powdered pumice every year."
http://www.guardian.co.uk/g2/story/0,,497788,00.html

attributes.name: Warehouse - distribution
attributes.title: Warehouse - distribution
attributes.description: Travels by train and boat from Africa to a distribution warehouse, before entering the market.
